text: Lambo Sandjo Pierre Roger (7 April 1957 - 16 March 2014), better known as Lapiro de Mbanga, was a Cameroonian singer. He is best known for his 1985 recording of “Pas argent no love” and for being imprisoned in 2008 after criticizing Cameroon president Paul Biya in the song “Constitution constipée” (“Constipated Constitution”). He was born in Mbanga, Southwest Region. Mbanga died from cancer on 16 March 2014 in Buffalo, New York in the United States. He was 56 years old. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Cameroonian musicians Category:Cancer deaths in New York (state) Category:Hip hop musicians Category:Singers
title: Lapiro de Mbanga
